item.description:
It's a "do over" or make up hike for the wash out from three weeks ago. Its a little cooler so that means frost and overnite freezing likely. A wool hat and gloves are recommended. Mt. Chocorua is about 3 hours from Providence so I'll plan to do a day hike.

Mt. Chocorua is a good bit of exercise (moderate hike) despite it's modest summit at 3,490 feet above sea level. We'll follow the Champney Trail to the summit for about 8.5 miles round trip. This should take about 6.5 hrs. This mountain is one of the most photographed mountains in the world and it has some great waterfalls.The summit is treeless, which which means great 360 degree views but it can mean changing weather and high winds.  Precautions for extra layers, food and water just in case. I recommend you bring a wind breaker/jacket, hat, gloves and a head lamp. We'll hang out at the summit for lunch, weather permitting, and return on the same ro ute or take the longer route back to the car depending upon conditions and timing.

Dennis' Cell #: 401-556-8955

Here are a couple of links with mountain info:

http://www.fs.fed.us/r9/forests/white_mountain/recreation/hiking/chocorua.pdf

http://www.hikenewengland.com/ChocoruaNH090405.html#trailguide

EQUIPMENT:

Cool Weather/Fall Essentials (required):
• Synthetic Quick-drying Pants
• Synthetic Quick-drying L/S Shirt
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/shoes
• Synthetic/Wool Socks
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket
• Light/Mid-weight Insulating Layers (undershirt/underpants)
• Extra pair of Socks
• Hat/Gloves
• Rain/Soft Shell Jacket/Pants
• Water (2-3L)
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)

the Remaining Essentials:
• Medications/First Aid Supplies
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

* Pocket knife

• Headlamp/Flashlight
• Compass/Map

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant
• Light-weight Wind Jacket (if your insulated or rain jacket isn’t windproof)
• Hand Warmers
• Trekking Poles
• Gaiters
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter
• Camera/Binoculars

* Micro spikes (I'll advise on this as weather reports are current)

Important:
No Jeans, No Sneakers, No Cotton Clothing.
item.name: "Get Up" and Hike Mt. Chocorua
